com.wingfoot.xml.schema
Class Attribute

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.wingfoot.xml.schema.Component
        |
        +--com.wingfoot.xml.schema.Attribute
public class Attribute
extends Component

Encapsulates an attribute or a reference to an attribute. An attribute is always of a simple type. The simple type is defined either using the base attribute or using an inline simple type

In an XML instance, an Attribute may occur once or not at all.

Note that an attribute declaration must appear at the end of complex type definition.

Constructor Detail

Attribute

public Attribute(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String targetNamespace,
                 Type type,
                 boolean isScopeGlobal)
          throws SchemaException
Creates an instance of the Attribute.
Parameters:
name - QName of the attribute. The name is mandatory. If type is null it is defaulted to xsd:anyType.
the - namespace associated to this attribute; null if there is no namespace
isScopeGlobal - true if the attribute can be accessed by any element or attributeGroup; false if not. Global attributes have the <schema> element as its parent.
Throws:
SchemaException - if the name is null or type is not SimpleType or XSDType

Attribute

public Attribute(QName ref)
          throws SchemaException
Creates an Attribute that is a reference to another Attribute in the schema.
Parameters:
ref - the value of this parameter is a reference to another Attribute instance in the schema.
Throws:
SchemaException - if the ref attribute is null
Method Detail

isScopeGlobal

public boolean isScopeGlobal()
Returns the scope of the attribute.
Returns:
boolean true if the scope is global false if not global.

isReference

public boolean isReference()
Method to determine if the Attribute is a reference to another global attribute declaration. A reference Attribute is created using the Attribut(String ref) constructor.
Returns:
boolean true if it is a reference; false if not.

setUse

public void setUse(int use)
            throws SchemaException
Controls the occurance of the Attribute in the XML instance. The parameter is one of Attribute.REQUIRED, Attribute.OPTIONAL or Attribute.PROBIHITED.
Parameters:
use - the occurance parameter. It is one of the final integers defined in this class.
Throws:
SchemaException - if the use is invalid OR if a default is set for the Attribute.

getUse

public int getUse()
Retruns the usage occurance of the Attribute. The default is optional.
Returns:
the usage occurance

setDefault

public void setDefault(java.lang.String theDefault)
                throws SchemaException
Sets the default for this Attribute. It is an error to provide a default when the occurance is NOT Attribute.Optional.
Parameters:
default - the default value of this attribute
Throws:
SchemaException - if getUse method returns a value other than Attribute.OPTIONAL OR if the fixed property is set.

getDefault

public java.lang.String getDefault()
Returns the default for this Attribute.
Returns:
the default for this Attribute; null if no default is set.

setAdditionalAttributes

public void setAdditionalAttributes(QName attrName,
                                    QName attrValue)
An <attribute> element iteself can have additional attributes. This method sets such attributes. An instance where such additional attributes are needed is wsdl:arrayType for defining the default data type for SOAP Section V array encoding
Parameters:
attrName - QName of the attribute name. If no namespace is desired for the attribute name, leave it as null.
attrValue - QName of the attribute name. If no namespace is desired for the attribute name, leave it as null.

setAdditionalAttributes

public void setAdditionalAttributes(java.util.Hashtable additionalAttributes)

getAdditionalAttributes

public java.util.Hashtable getAdditionalAttributes()
Returns any additonal attributes previously set.
Returns:
Hashtable of any additional attributes; null if none has been set.
